revised_title: Anatomy and Affinities of the Family of the Medusae
tldr: The author, Thomas Henry Huxley, investigates the anatomy and evolutionary relationships of the Medusae family, a group of marine invertebrates. He describes their various structures, such as the disc, tentacles, stomach, and generative organs, and discusses their classification into three classes: Cryptocarpae, Phanerocarpae, and Rhizostomidae.
